columns.name: id
columns.comment: Unique ID / primary key for deployment.

columns.name: deployed_equipment
columns.comment: The deployed equipment.

columns.name: host
columns.comment: The host / observing facility where the equipment is deployed.

columns.name: height_above_local_reference_surface
columns.comment: Installation height of equipment above reference surface (in meters).

columns.name: local_reference_surface
columns.comment: The local reference surface.

columns.name: valid_from
columns.comment: Date that this record is valid from.

columns.name: valid_to
columns.comment: Date that this record is valid to.

columns.name: communication_method
columns.comment: The primary data communication method.

columns.name: source_of_observation
columns.comment: The source of the observation (manual, automatic, visual etc.).

columns.name: exposure
columns.comment: The degree to which an instrument is affected by external influences according to the exposure classification (see WMO No. 8).

columns.name: measurement_quality
columns.comment: Expected quality of measurements from the sensor in teh current configuration according to the measurement quality classification (see WMO-No. 8).

columns.name: representativeness
columns.comment: An assessment of the representativeness of the observations.

columns.name: configuration
columns.comment: Description of any shielding or configuration/setup of the instrumentation.

columns.name: control_schedule
columns.comment: Description of schedule for calibrations or verification of instrument.

columns.name: maintenance_schedule
columns.comment: A description (and schedule) of maintenance that is routinely performed on an instrument.

columns.name: links
columns.comment: Link(s) to further information on deployment.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: ID / primary key.

columns.name: location
columns.comment: Location of observation.

columns.name: elevation
columns.comment: Elevation of observation above mean sea level (in meters).

columns.name: observation_type
columns.comment: Type of observation.

columns.name: phenomenon_start
columns.comment: Start time of the phenomenon being observed or observing period, if missing assumed instantaneous with time given by phenomenon_end.

columns.name: phenomenon_end
columns.comment: End time of the phenomenon being observed or observing period.

columns.name: result_value
columns.comment: The value of the result in float representation.

columns.name: result_uom
columns.comment: Units used to represent the value being observed.

columns.name: result_description
columns.comment: str representation of the result if applicable.

columns.name: result_quality
columns.comment: JSON representation of the result quality, key / value pairs.

columns.name: result_time
columns.comment: Time that the result became available.

columns.name: valid_from
columns.comment: Time that the result starts to be valid.

columns.name: valid_to
columns.comment: Time after which the result is no longer valid.

columns.name: host
columns.comment: Host associated with making the observation, equivalent to OGC OMS 'host'.

columns.name: observer
columns.comment: Observer associated with making the observation, equivalent to OGC OMS 'observer'.

columns.name: observed_property
columns.comment: The phenomenon, or thing, being observed.

columns.name: observing_procedure
columns.comment: Procedure used to make the observation.

columns.name: dataset
columns.comment: Primary dataset that this observation belongs to.

columns.name: parameter
columns.comment: List of key/ value pairs in dict.

columns.name: featureOfInterest
columns.comment: Feature of interest that this observation is associated with.

columns.name: equipment
columns.comment: The equipment / sensor to which this record applies.

columns.name: observed_property
columns.comment: The observed parameter to which this record applies.

columns.name: observing_method
columns.comment: Primary method/principles by which the sensor makes measurements.

columns.name: observing_method_details
columns.comment: A description of the method of measurement/observation used.

columns.name: measurement_units
columns.comment: The units used in this record.

columns.name: drift_per_unit_time
columns.comment: Intrinsic capability of the measurement/observing method - drift per unit time. Typically a percentage per unit time but could be absolute e.g. 1 degree per year.

columns.name: unit_time
columns.comment: Unit time for drift per unit time (seconds).

columns.name: valid_min
columns.comment: Minimum observable value by sensor, in units specified by measurement units.

columns.name: valid_max
columns.comment: Maximum observable value by sensor, in units specified by measurement units.

columns.name: specified_absolute_uncertainty
columns.comment: Measurement uncertainty for measurements from this sensor, 2 sigma. Units as per measurement units.

columns.name: specified_relative_uncertainty
columns.comment: Measurement uncertainty for measurements from this sensor, 2 sigma. Units in %, e.g. 20 %.

columns.comment: Link(s) to further information.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: A unique identifier of the catalogue record.

columns.name: time
columns.comment: The temporal extent of the resource. Can be null if there is no associated temporal extent.

columns.name: title
columns.comment: A human-readable name given to the resource.

columns.name: location
columns.comment: A geometry associated with the resource that is used for discovery. Can be null if there is no associated geometry.

columns.name: created
columns.comment: Date of creation of this record.

columns.name: updated
columns.comment: The most recent date on which the record was changed.

columns.name: resource_type
columns.comment: The nature or genre of the resource. The value should be a code, convenient for filtering records. Where available, a link to the canonical URI of the record type resource will be added to the 'links' property.

columns.name: description
columns.comment: A free-text account of the resource.

columns.name: keywords
columns.comment: The topic or topics of the resource. Typically represented using free-form keywords, tags, key phrases, or classification codes. Semi-colon delimited

columns.name: language
columns.comment: The natural language used for textual values (e.g. titles, descriptions, etc.) of the resource. ISO 639-1/639-2 codes should be used.

columns.name: external_ids
columns.comment: An identifier for the resource assigned by an external (to the catalogue) entity.

columns.name: themes
columns.comment: A knowledge organization system used to classify the resource.

columns.name: formats
columns.comment: A list of available distributions of the resource.

columns.name: providers
columns.comment: A list of providers qualified by their role in association to the record.

columns.name: license
columns.comment: A legal document under which the resource is made available. The value should be a code, convenient for filtering the records. Where applicable, the use of the identifiers from the SPDX License List is recommended. If multiple licenses apply, it is recommended to use ''various'.  Where available, links to a URI of each applicable license should be added to the 'links' property.

columns.name: rights
columns.comment: A statement that concerns all rights not addressed by the license such as a copyright statement.

columns.name: links
columns.comment: A list of links for accessing the resource (e.g. download link, access link) in one of the supported distribution formats and/or links to other resources associated with this resource. Also, a list of links for navigating the API (e.g. prev, next, etc.).  Since the specification requires that at least the self link be present then the min items for this list should be one.

columns.name: id
columns.comment: Primary key for this record.

columns.name: deployment
columns.comment: The deployment this record belongs to.

columns.name: media
columns.comment: The media this record belongs to.

columns.name: valid_from
columns.comment: Date from which the media is valid.

columns.name: valid_to
columns.comment: Date from which the media is no longer valid.

columns.name: _version
columns.comment: Version number of this record.

columns.name: _change_date
columns.comment: Date this record was changed.

columns.name: _user
columns.comment: Which user/agent last modified this record.

columns.name: _status
columns.comment: Whether this is the latest version or an archived version of the record.

columns.name: _comments
columns.comment: Free text comments on this record, for example description of changes made etc.
